ObjectInputStream ois = new ObjectInputStream(is);

while (gameOver == false) {
    char[][] board = new char[3][3];
    try {
        oos.writeObject(board);
        oos.flush();
        board = (char[][]) ois.readObject();
    } catch (IOException | ClassNotFoundException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: Instead of using InputStream and OutputStream, you can use ObjectInputStream and ObjectOutputStream to send and receive objects over sockets. In this case, you can send the 2D char array as an object using writeObject() method and receive it using readObject() method. Make sure to flush the ObjectOutputStream after writing the object.
